hint.text: Find slant height using pythagoras theorem.

solution.text:
Height of cone,h \(=_{j}_\)cm
Diameter of cone,d \(=_{k}_\)cm\(\Rightarrow\)Radius,r\(=_{{k/Decimal(2)}}_\)cm
Slant height,l\(=\sqrt{h^2+r^2}=\sqrt{_{j}_^2+_{{k/Decimal(2)}}_^2}=_{{trunc(((j**2+(k/Decimal(2))**2)**Decimal(0.5)),3)}}_\)cm
Curved surface area\(=\pi rl\)
\(=\pi \times _{{k/Decimal(2)}}_ \times _{{trunc(((j**2+(k/Decimal(2))**2)**Decimal(0.5)),3)}}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*(k/Decimal(2))*(j**2+(k/Decimal(2))**2)**Decimal(0.5)),3)}}_\,cm^2\)

content.text:
The height of a cone is \(_{j}_\)cm and its diameter is \(_{k}_\)cm. Find:
The curved surface area of the cone.
